item.title: Best Weapons in Stalker 2 for Every Situation
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/best-weapons-in-stalker-2-for-every-situation/

You’ll find all manner of weapons throughout the Zone, and while many of them come to you broken and worn, they’re still viable if you don’t mind spending a little money on repairs. But sometimes, it’s not worthwhile. It’s better to stick with what you know, what you’ve spent time upgrading and using frequently. Yes, the game does have “meta” weapons that excel, whereas others falter. Here is an overview of the best weapons in Stalker 2 for every situation!

Stalker 2’s Best Weapons for Every Encounter

It’s life or death in the Zone, and a competent weapon that’s well-maintained, upgraded, and customized with a few worthwhile attachments that you’re comfortable using makes a difference. Of course, not any old weapon will suffice. You want the meta. You want the rifle that’ll keep you alive in mid-range encounters, the sniper rifle for long-range precision, and the up-close-and-personal shotgun to clear abandoned labs. These are the best weapons in Stalker 2 that I recommend for every player:

  • Best All-Around Weapon: The AKM-74S is an easy to acquire assault rifle with one of the most common ammo types available in the Zone. With a relatively low overall weight, manageable recoil, and relatively stable accuracy across mid and long-range engagements, you’ll find the starting AKM a stalwart companion through most of the game.
  • Best CQB Weapon: The Ram-2 is not only a gorgeous bullpup-style shotgun with multiple barrelts but also a powerful one capable of clearing a hallway with ease. It’s a large weapon, taking up a 5×2 slot in your inventory, but that space isn’t going to waste. With high damage and rate of fire, the Ram-2 offers the discerning Stalker a chance at toppling enemies who dare to enter your personal bubble.
  • Best Pistol: Skif’s Pistol, yes, is a starting weapon and a PM. It’s not the most powerful handgun in the game, a title most will agree goes to the revolver, but your first handgun is special. It’s lightweight, highly customizable and upgradeable, versatile, and its ammunition—9x18mm PST—is readily available from the jump.
  • Best Customizable Rifle: The AR416 feels like it should be a rare assault rifle, but it’s not. You can find it on Ward Soldiers at the Laboratory in Garbage, you’ll also occasionally receive one as a quest reward, such as during the Poppy Fields.
  • Best Sniper Rifle: The M701 Super shines as one of the most attractive and powerful sniper rifles in the Zone. It’s a bolt-action precision rifle that’s powerful, heavy, and expensive. Oh, and you can only upgrade it at Harpy in Yaniv Station, making it a bit of a unicorn. But for all of its downfalls, which aren’t really that bad, the M701 will serve you well in clearing enemy forces from afar.

What’s your favorite gun in Stalker 2? Let us know in the comments below, or start a discussion on our community forum!

No matter what weapon you’re rocking, knowing how to deal with anomalies in Stalker 2 is a life skill that every scavenger requires!

item.title: Latest Windows Update Stops Ubisoft Games from Working
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/windows-update-stops-ubisoft-games-from-working/

The Windows 11 version 24H2 update is currently causing issues when playing certain Ubisoft games. 

According to the latest update on Microsoft’s website, the Windows 24H2 update causes several issues while playing specific Ubisoft games, which included unresponsiveness while launching, loading or playing the games. Some users have also reported facing black screens while playing these titles. Check out all the affected games below: 

  • Assassin’s Creed Valhalla
  • Assassin’s Creed Origins
  • Assassin’s Creed Odyssey
  • Star Wars Outlaws
  • Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora

Ubisoft has “released a temporary mitigation for Star Wars Outlaws to prevent the game from failing and stop responding” in the latest Windows 11 update. However, players might still encounter performance issues even after this hotfix. A permanent fix is currently being worked on. 

The Windows 11 24H2 update is a phased rollout that will arrive for all eligible devices within the coming weeks. If the update becomes available for your device, it will be downloaded and installed automatically. 

In other news, Ubisoft has clarified the Assassin’s Creed Animus hub rumours. Also, Project U is back on the drawing board after 5 years of development. What are your thoughts on the latest Windows 11 update stopping Ubisoft games from working?

item.title: Sniper Elite: Resistance Preview – A Familiar Feeling
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/sniper-elite-resistance-preview/

Playing Sniper Elite: Resistance brings a familiar feel to long-time players of the franchise. A game that runs parallel to the events of Sniper Elite 5, Resistance once again puts you in France with the goal of disrupting Nazi plans that could change the course of World War II.

I recently spent over an hour playing Sniper Elite: Resistance where I got to go through the game’s third mission, and experience just a taste of what developer Rebellion has in store for players. 

Now, I’m not going to lie to you. If you’ve played Sniper Elite 4 or 5, you’ve played Sniper Elite: Resistance. The game uses the same engine with gameplay that’s nearly identical to its 2022 predecessor. Rather than play as Karl Fairburne, however, you’re controlling Harry Hawker, who sounds an awful lot like Jason Statham.

HELP INSIDER GAMING: Take Our 2024 Reader Survey

With it being a connected title, the general environment and feeling is similar to what you get with Sniper Elite 5. And although I only played one region of the game, one thing that’s clear with Resistance is that the designers have done enough to make the environment stand on its own. Finding all of the unique ways to take cover and distract the enemies is what lets the Sniper Elite series pull you in as a player, and the level designers did a good job with what I saw.

You can still play at your own pace, something that goes a long way towards getting more players to enjoy the game. Whether I wanted to go in guns blazing or take it as slow as humanly possible, I’m able to do that. It just all depends on what’s happening around me and what I’m trying to accomplish. There are multiple ways to get to, and complete, an objective that you can replay the mission multiple times and it’ll feel fresh for a few playthroughs.

The kill cam that the Sniper Elite series is known for remains as satisfying as ever. Hitting that perfect shot that has you watch a bullet rip through the face of a Nazi is as gruesome as you’d expect. It’s also enjoyable watching the other soldiers scramble and panic after they see a comrade’s head get blown to pieces right next to them.

In the preview build, we couldn’t change the difficulty, meaning we were limited in how we could experience the game from that sense. Luckily, the AI wasn’t too unforgiving, though it did make you work. 

It was nice that when the AI was searching for something (me) after hearing a noise, they wouldn’t play too dumb, so to speak. Plenty of games I’ve played would have the AI stand right on top of you and not notice a thing if you were in cover. In this, there were a couple of times where they would happen to walk right up on me only to spot my cover while I wasn’t moving, leading to me having to fight my way out or die trying.

That said, the AI weren’t savants all of the time. There were times where they would just stand a bit too still or in the same place so long to the point you couldn’t continue without adjusting in a way that didn’t feel natural to what you should or were trying to do.

They can even be too locked in their planned movement. One specific instance involves a Gestapo infantryman always having to sit on a bench, stand up, and then turn and look at the bench before walking around the building to just repeat the sequence. It feels a bit strange in those moments that are more than enough to break immersion. 

There was also an instance where it was pretty clear my shot should have hit an enemy in the face only for him to get hit, get up, and just slowly walk away while another bullet just ricochets off his helmet while he continues to walk. Maybe the shot wasn’t as good as I thought it was at the time, but something just felt off with what I believe should’ve happened.

Nevertheless, what I played had me excited about the full story and just how else I’ll be able to take down the Nazi’s in France this time around. However, one thing I kept thinking about after my time with the game was whether there will be enough here with a full game to warrant a purchase by fans. 

There’s a full campaign, the returning invasion mode, and new Propaganda Missions that Rebellion hopes keeps players engaged overall. But as I said at the beginning, if you’ve played either of the last two Sniper Elite titles, this will feel quite familiar, especially when the overall setting remains the same from the last game just with new locations. With Resistance coming less than three full years after Sniper Elite 5 – the gap between 4 and 5 was over five years – Rebellion runs the risk of franchise fatigue if the rest of the game’s story doesn’t hold up.

Sniper Elite: Resistance launches January 30 for Xbox, PlayStation, and PC.

item.title: Black Ops 6 Season 1 Reloaded: Release date, new guns, CODMAS event & more
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/black-ops-6-season-1-reloaded-release-date-new-guns-codmas-event-more/

Black Ops 6 Season 1 has already introduced a load of new content, from the Krig C and Saug SMG to new maps and modes. That said, the devs still have more up their sleeve, as the mid-season Reloaded update is set to bring another wave of content for players.

For those interested in what’s coming in the Black Ops 6 Season 1 Reloaded update, as well as the update’s release date, here are all the details you need to know.

  • When is Black Ops 6 Season 1 Reloaded update?
  • New weapons
  • New maps & modes
  • CODMAS event in Black Ops 6

When is Black Ops 6 Season 1 Reloaded update?

BO6 Season 1 Reloaded will arrive on Thursday, December 5, 2024, at around 10 AM PT / 1 PM ET / 6 PM GMT.

Treyarch confirmed this via X, where they announced the release date for the new Zombie map, Citadelle des Morts, which arrives with the mid-season update.

New weapons in Season 1 Reloaded

The Maelstorm Shotgun, AMR Mod 4 Sniper Rifle, and Cleaver Melee Weapon will all be arriving with the Black Ops 6 Season 1 Reloaded update.

According to the CoD blog, these weapons will be available via an “Event Reward.” This likely means that players will need to complete an in-game challenge in order to unlock them, similar to the Sirin 9mm and Power Drill in the Hit List event.

New maps & modes

Black Ops 4’s Hacienda arrives as a 6v6 map in BO6 Season 1 Reloaded. Players will also be getting a new, smaller Strike map called Racket, while Nuketown Holiday brings the Christmas Holiday vibes to the iconic Black Ops map.

The devs also revealed that Prop Hunt will be available “in-season,” so we expect that mode to arrive after Season 1 Reloaded. Further, limited-time modes will also be arriving, which seem to be associated with the CODMAS event.

Citadelle des Morts

The brand-new round-based Zombies map, Citadelle des Morts, arrives on December 5th alongside the update, bringing yet another Easter egg for players to complete.

The map is set in an abandoned Castle in Europe, and leaks suggest that the map will feature elemental swords and the iconic Wunderwaffe DG2. For all the details on the new Zombies map, check out our detailed guide on Citadelle des Morts.

CODMAS event in BO6 Season 1 Reloaded

To celebrate the Christmas holidays, Black Ops 6 will host yet another CODMAS event in Call of Duty. This event will bring a variety of rewards for players to earn, all with a holiday theme.

In the past, we’ve seen CODMAS bring a variety of cosmetics to the game as well as map makeovers, which Nuketown Holiday will bring. We’ve also seen limited-time modes like Krampus too, so perhaps players can expect something similar for BO6.

Are you excited for the Black Ops 6 Season 1 Reloaded update? Let us know what content you’re most looking forward to by leaving a comment in the forum.

item.title: Christopher Judge Denies God of War Announcement Tease
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/god-of-war-announcement-denied/

Christopher Judge has taken to X (formerly Twitter) to deny that he was teasing an announcement about God of War.

The God of War actor recently took to TikTok to say that “the next two weeks will be chocked full of announcements and all kinds of good stuff. ” He ended the message by saying “boy,” a phrase that became popular in the recent God of War games.

Whether Judge knew it or not, his tease that there would be announcements “in the next two weeks” coincides perfectly with PlayStation’s 30th anniversary, leading people to believe that an announcement of God of War is on the horizon.

Earlier this year, several rumors circulated that a God of War Trilogy remaster was in the works. Judge’s tease, combined with the rumors, led many fans to conclude that it could be announced during a rumored 30th-anniversary showcase.

However, Judge quickly denied the claims on X. “Absolutely not true! You can’t tease something you know nothing about. I will be making announcements in the near future, I can guarantee none of them will be about OUR beloved God of War. I am awaiting updates just like everyone else,” he said.

Whether Judge got into trouble with PlayStation because of his original statements remains to be seen, with some people suggesting that the tweet was just to keep the impending announcement a surprise.

As for now though, we’ll have to wait and see. Do you think we’ll get a God of War announcement in the coming weeks? Let us know below, and join the official Insider Gaming forums discussion.
